Question: Got all ingredients. What do I have to start with now? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened, 1/2 cup butter, softened, 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 cup white sugar, 1/3 cup milk, 1/2 pound ground walnuts, 1/3 cup confectioners' sugar for decoration, 
Directions: 0) Beat together cream cheese and margarine until well blended. 1) Add flour, mixing well. 2) Shape into a ball, cover and chill for 2 hours. 3) In saucepan over medium heat, cook sugar and milk, stirring occasionally until milk boils and sugar is dissolved. 4) Add the ground nuts. 5) Remove from heat and let cool until mixture is of spreading consistency. 6) Roll out chilled dough on lightly floured surface to a rectangle about 18 X 12 inches. 7) Cut in half lengthwise. 8) Spread each piece with milk/nut filling and roll up like a jelly-roll, starting from the long side. 9) Cut each roll in half. 10) Place seam side down on ungreased cookie sheets (two on a baking sheet). 11) Leaving roll's shape intact, cut into slices 1/2 inch thick almost to the bottom of the roll. 12) Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 15 to 20 minutes or till done. 13) Remove from sheet and sprinkle with confectioners' sugar. 14) Cool on racks. 15) Cut cookies all the way through. 16) Refrigerate or freeze. 17) Resprinkle with confectioners' sugar before serving.
conv_answer: You start by beating together cream cheese and butter until well blended.

 Context: Ingredients: 3 tablespoons crushed black peppercorns, 2 (8 ounce) beef top sirloin steaks, 1 tablespoon lemon pepper, 1 teaspoon salt, 5 tablespoons butter, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 cup red wine, 3 tablespoons brandy, 1/4 cup chopped green onions, 1 shallot, chopped, 1/2 cup heavy cream, 1 teaspoon white sugar (optional), 
Directions: 0) Press crushed peppercorns into both sides of each steak. 1) Sprinkle with lemon pepper, and salt. 2) Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. 3) Stir in garlic and wine, and cook for 1 minute. 4) Arrange steaks in pan, and cook for 5 to 10 minutes per side, or until desired doneness. 5) Reduce heat to low. 6) Pour brandy onto steaks, and carefully light with a match. 7) Let the flames burn off. 8) Sprinkle green onion and shallot around the steaks, and circle the steaks with cream. 9) Cook, stirring sauce, until hot. 10) Transfer steaks to plates. 11) Stir sugar into sauce, and then spoon over meat.
conv_answer: The first step is to press the crushed peppercorns into both sides of each steak.

Question: Ok hm I like Worchester sauce. What is next? 
 Context: Ingredients: 12 leaves cabbage, 1 cup cooked white rice, 1 egg, beaten, 1/4 cup milk, 1/4 cup minced onion, 1 pound extra-lean ground beef, 1 1/4 teaspoons salt, 1 1/4 teaspoons ground black pepper, 1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce, 1 tablespoon brown sugar, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce, 
Directions: 0) Bring a large pot of water to a boil. 1) Boil cabbage leaves 2 minutes; drain. 2) In large bowl, combine 1 cup cooked rice, egg, milk, onion, ground beef, salt, and pepper. 3) Place about 1/4 cup of meat mixture in center of each cabbage leaf, and roll up, tucking in ends. 4) Place rolls in slow cooker. 5) In a small bowl, mix together tomato sauce, brown sugar, lemon juice, and Worcestershire sauce. 6) Pour over cabbage rolls. 7) Cover, and cook on low 8 to 9 hours.

Question: Ok. nice I have them all ready. What is the first step now to take in order to cook the dish? baked spaghetti squash las ##na 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 spaghetti squash, halved lengthwise and seeded, 1 onion, chopped, 2 tablespoons minced garlic, 2 (14 ounce) cans stewed tomatoes, 1 tablespoon dried basil, 1 cube vegetable bouillon, black pepper to taste, 1 (15 ounce) can black olives, chopped, 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese, 1 cup shredded Parmesan cheese, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). 1) Spray a baking sheet with a thin layer of cooking spray. 2) Place squash halves cut side down on the baking sheet. 3) Bake squash 35 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a knife can be easily inserted. 4) Remove from oven, and cool. 5) Meanwhile, spray a non-stick saucepan with cooking spray. 6) Over medium heat, saute the onion and garlic until golden brown. 7) Stir in tomatoes, basil, bouillon cube, and black pepper. 8) Cook for about 15 minutes, or until you have a medium thick sauce. 9) Remove squash strands with a fork, reserving the shells. 10) Layer each half with a spoonful of the sauce, a layer of spaghetti squash strands, olives, and mozzarella cheese. 11) Repeat layers until shells are full, or until all of the ingredients are used. 12) Top with Parmesan cheese. 13) Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until Parmesan cheese melts.
conv_answer: Now we preheat the oven to 325 degrees Fahrenheit.
target_answer: 0) Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).

Question: Ok, I got the blender here. What do I combine first? 
 Context: Ingredients: 2 eggs, 1/4 cup water, 6 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 2 tablespoons chopped onion, 1 tablespoon butter, 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour, 1 cup milk, 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, divided, 1 1/2 teaspoons Dijon mustard, 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, 1/8 teaspoon salt, 2 cups frozen chopped broccoli, thawed, 
Directions: 0) For batter, combine the eggs, water, flour and salt in a blender. 1) Cover and process until smooth; let stand for 15 minutes. 2) Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, saute onion in butter until tender. 3) Stir in flour until blended. 4) Gradually stir in milk. 5) Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until slightly thickened. 6) Reduce heat to low. 7) Stir in 1/2 cup cheese, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, pepper and salt until cheese is melted. 8) Stir in broccoli. 9) Cover; keep warm. 10) Heat a lightly greased 8-in. nonstick skillet; pour 2 tablespoons batter into the center of skillet. 11) Lift and tilt pan to evenly coat bottom. 12) Cook until top appears dry; turn and cook 15-20 seconds longer. 13) Remove to a wire rack. 14) Repeat with remaining batter, greasing skillet as needed. 15) Spoon about 1/2 cup filling down the center of each crepe; roll up. 16) Place seam side down in an ungreased 11-in. baking dish. 17) Sprinkle with remaining cheese. 18) Bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees F for 5-7 minutes or until cheese is melted.
conv_answer: First, add 2 eggs, 1/4 cup water and 6 tablespoons all-purpose flour.

Directions: 0) For batter, combine the eggs, water, flour and salt in a blender. 1) Cover and process until smooth; let stand for 15 minutes. 2) Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, saute onion in butter until tender. 3) Stir in flour until blended. 4) Gradually stir in milk. 5) Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until slightly thickened. 6) Reduce heat to low. 7) Stir in 1/2 cup cheese, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, pepper and salt until cheese is melted. 8) Stir in broccoli. 9) Cover; keep warm. 10) Heat a lightly greased 8-in. nonstick skillet; pour 2 tablespoons batter into the center of skillet. 11) Lift and tilt pan to evenly coat bottom. 12) Cook until top appears dry; turn and cook 15-20 seconds longer. 13) Remove to a wire rack. 14) Repeat with remaining batter, greasing skillet as needed. 15) Spoon about 1/2 cup filling down the center of each crepe; roll up. 16) Place seam side down in an ungreased 11-in. baking dish. 17) Sprinkle with remaining cheese. 18) Bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees F for 5-7 minutes or until cheese is melted.
conv_answer: No. You also need to add water and flour.
target_answer: 0) For batter, combine the eggs, water, flour and salt in a blender.

predictions: 1) Cover and process until smooth; let stand for 15 minutes.
labels: 1) Cover and process until smooth; let stand for 15 minutes.

Question: Ok alright I have them all ready. 
 Context: Ingredients: 3/4 teaspoon active dry yeast, 1/2 cup warm water, 3 1/2 cups unbleached bread flour, 1 1/4 cups cold water,

Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Melt 1/2 cup butter and heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. 2) Cook and stir the mushroom slices in the skillet until tender. 3) Remove from heat, cover to keep warm, and set aside. 4) Melt the remaining butter and heat the remaining oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. 5) Cook and stir the garlic until tender, then gradually whisk in the flour. 6) Increase heat to high, and pour in the beef broth and Marsala wine. 7) Season with kosher salt and pepper, and whisk in the browning sauce. 8) Bring to a boil, and reduce heat to low. 9) Mix in the mushrooms, reserving remaining butter and oil in the skillet. 10) Cover saucepan, remove from heat, and set aside. 11) Season chicken with salt and pepper, and dredge in the remaining flour. 12) Cook the chicken 2 minutes per side, until browned. 13) Arrange the chicken in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish, and cover with the sauce and mushroom mixture. 14) Cover baking dish, and bake 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until chicken juices run clear.

 Context: Ingredients: 1 cup packed brown sugar, 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg, 1/2 cup chopped pecans, 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 cup butter, softened, 1 cup white sugar, 3/4 cup apple butter, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1/2 cup whole bran cereal or wheat germ, 1 cup sour cream, 2 eggs, beaten, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Question: Ok. They are ready! Can we start with the recipe? recipe 
 Context: Ingredients: 4 egg whites, 1 1/4 cups white sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 teaspoon lemon juice, 2 teaspoons cornstarch, 1 pint heavy cream, 6 kiwi, peeled and sliced, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). 1) Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. 2) Draw a 9 inch circle on the parchment paper. 3) In a large bowl, beat egg whites until stiff but not dry. 4) Gradually add in the sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, beating well after each addition. 5) Beat until thick and glossy. 6) Overbeaten egg whites lose volume and deflate when folded into other ingredients. 7) Be absolutely sure not a particle of grease or egg yolk gets into the whites. 8) Gently fold in vanilla extract, lemon juice and cornstarch. 9) Spoon mixture inside the circle drawn on the parchment paper. 10) Working from the center, spread mixture toward the outside edge, building edge slightly. 11) This should leave a slight depression in the center. 12) Bake for 1 hour. 13) Cool on a wire rack. 14) Remove the paper, and place meringue on a flat serving plate. 15) Fill the center of the meringue with whipped cream, sweetened if desired. 16) Top whipped cream with kiwifruit slices.
conv_answer: Yes good! Now preheat the oven to 150 degrees Celsius.
target_answer: 0) Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).

predictions: 1) Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
labels: 1) Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

 Context: Ingredients: 4 egg whites, 1 1/4 cups white sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 teaspoon lemon juice, 2 teaspoons cornstarch, 1 pint heavy cream, 6 kiwi, peeled and sliced, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). 1) Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. 2) Draw a 9 inch circle on the parchment paper. 3) In a large bowl, beat egg whites until stiff but not dry. 4) Gradually add in the sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, beating well after each addition. 5) Beat until thick and glossy. 6) Overbeaten egg whites lose volume and deflate when folded into other ingredients. 7) Be absolutely sure not a particle of grease or egg yolk gets into the whites. 8) Gently fold in vanilla extract, lemon juice and cornstarch. 9) Spoon mixture inside the circle drawn on the parchment paper. 10) Working from the center, spread mixture toward the outside edge, building edge slightly. 11) This should leave a slight depression in the center. 12) Bake for 1 hour. 13) Cool on a wire rack. 14) Remove the paper, and place meringue on a flat serving plate. 15) Fill the center of the meringue with whipped cream, sweetened if desired. 16) Top whipped cream with kiwifruit slices.
conv_answer: Not yet, Now fill the center of the meringue with whipped cream, sweetened if desired.
target_answer: 15) Fill the center of the meringue with whipped cream, sweetened if desired.

predictions: 16) Top whipped cream with kiwifruit slices.
labels: 15) Fill the center of the meringue with whipped cream, sweetened if desired.

Directions: 0) Prepare and bake corn bread according to package directions, using the egg and milk. 1) Meanwhile, in a large skillet, cook beef and onion over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain. 2) Stir in the spaghetti sauce, corn, chilies and sloppy joe mix. 3) Bring to a boil. 4) Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes. 5) Sprinkle with cheese; cover and cook for 1 minute or until cheese is melted. 6) Cut corn bread into six pieces; cut each piece in half. 7) Top with sloppy joe mixture.

 Context: Ingredients: 8 cups shredded cabbage, 3 medium potatoes, cut into 1/2 inch cubes, 1 medium onion, chopped, 1 3/4 teaspoons salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, 1 (14.5 ounce) can chicken broth, 2 pounds fully cooked kielbasa or Polish sausage, cut into serving size pieces, 
Directions: 0) In a 5-qt. slow cooker, combine the cabbage, potatoes, onion, salt and pepper. 1) Pour broth over all. 2) Place sausage on top (slow cooker will be full, but cabbage will cook down). 3) Cover and cook on low for 8-9 hours or until vegetables are tender and sausage is heated through.

Directions: 0) Combine the flour with the baking powder, baking soda, salt and nutmeg. 1) In a clean 1 liter sized glass jar with a wide mouth layer the white sugar followed by the flour mixture. 2) Press firmly in place and seal. 3) Attach a card with the following instructions: In a large bowl: beat 1 egg with 1 cup softened butter or margarine until light and fluffy. 4) At low speed of an electric mixer add 1/2 cup sour cream, 1 teaspoon vanilla and contents of Jar. 5) Mix until combined. 6) Remove dough from the refrigerator. 7) Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). 8) Roll chilled dough out on a lightly floured surface to 1/8 inch thick. 9) Cut dough into desired shapes. 10) Place on an ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 10 to 12 minutes.

Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Grease one 9x5 inch loaf pan. 2) Measure flour, 1 cup sugar, baking powder, baking soda, 1 1/2 teaspoons cinnamon, salt, buttermilk, oil, eggs and vanilla into large mixing bowl. 3) Beat 3 minutes. 4) Pour into prepared loaf pan. 5) Smooth top. 6) Combine 2 tablespoons white sugar, 1 teaspoon cinnamon and butter, mixing until crumbly. 7) Sprinkle topping over smoothed batter. 8) Using knife, cut in a light swirling motion to give a marbled effect. 9) Bake for about 50 minutes. 10) Test with toothpick. 11) When inserted it should come out clean. 12) Remove bread from pan to rack to cool.
